choicegroup.choice: There is a mystery red box, so an answer must be missing.
A checkbox problem has been used, so any single answer will be deemed incorrect as all answers must be selected.

div.p: Checkbox problems require every correct answer to be selected in order to grant full credit. This makes them a particularly bad choice for surveying learners. Instead, you might use a MCQ where every answer is considered right.
What's with the red box? Shouldn't that be an X? Turns out it's just a font glitch. It happened to us while we were taking the screenshot; it'll happen to you some day too.
